==Events==
* [[335]] &ndash; [[Athanasius of Alexandria|Athanasius]] is banished to [[Trier]], on charge that he prevented a [[Cereal|grain]] fleet from sailing to [[Constantinople]].
* [[680]] &ndash; The [[Third Council of Constantinople|Sixth Ecumenical Council]] commences in Constantinople.
*[[1426]] &ndash; [[Lam Sơn uprising|Lam Sơn]] rebels emerge victorious against the [[Ming Dynasty|Ming]] army in the [[Battle of Tốt Động – Chúc Động]] taking place in Đông Quan, in now [[Hanoi]], [[Viet Nam]].
*[[1492]] &ndash; The [[Ensisheim (meteorite)|Ensisheim meteorite]], the oldest [[meteorite]] with a known date of impact, strikes the [[earth]] around noon in a [[wheat]] field outside the village of [[Ensisheim]], [[Alsace]], [[France]].
*[[1619]] &ndash; [[Elizabeth Stuart, Queen of Bohemia|Elizabeth Stuart]] is [[coronation|crowned]] [[List of Bohemian royal consorts|Queen of Bohemia]].
*[[1665]] &ndash; The ''[[London Gazette]]'', the oldest surviving [[Newspaper|journal]], is first published.
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore|John Murray]], the [[Royal Governor of Virginia|Royal Governor]] of the [[Colony of Virginia]], starts the first mass emancipation of slaves in North America by issuing [[Dunmore's Proclamation|Lord Dunmore's Offer of Emancipation]], which offers freedom to slaves who abandoned their colonial masters in order to fight with Murray and the British.
*[[1786]] &ndash; The oldest musical organization in the [[United States]] is founded as the [[Stoughton Musical Society]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Tecumseh's War]]: The [[Battle of Tippecanoe]] is fought near present-day [[Battle Ground, Indiana]], [[United States]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; In [[Alton, Illinois]], [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionist]] printer [[Elijah P. Lovejoy]] is shot dead by a [[Crowd|mob]] while attempting to protect his printing shop from being destroyed a third time.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Belmont]]: In Belmont, Missouri, [[United States|Union]] forces led by [[General]] [[Ulysses S. Grant]] overrun a [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] camp but are forced to retreat when Confederate reinforcements arrive.
*[[1874]] &ndash; A [[cartoon]] by [[Thomas Nast]] in ''[[Harper's Magazine|Harper's Weekly]]'', is considered the first important use of an [[elephant]] as a symbol for the [[Republican Party (United States)|United States Republican Party]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; The completion of [[Canada]]'s first transcontinental railway is symbolized by the [[Last Spike (Canadian Pacific Railway)|Last Spike]] ceremony at [[Craigellachie, British Columbia]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[History of women's suffrage in the United States|Women's Suffrage]]: Women in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Colorado]] are granted the right to vote, the second state to do so.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Battle of Leliefontein]], a battle during which the [[Royal Canadian Dragoons]] win three [[Victoria Crosses]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Delta Sigma Pi]] is founded at [[New York University]].
*  1907   &ndash; [[Jesús García]] saves the entire town of [[Nacozari de García|Nacozari de Garcia, Sonora]] by driving a burning train full of [[dynamite]] six kilometers (3.7 miles) away before it can explode.
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Butch Cassidy]] and the [[Sundance Kid]] are reportedly killed in San Vicente, Bolivia.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The first [[air freight]] shipment (from [[Dayton, Ohio]], to [[Columbus, Ohio]]) is undertaken by the [[Wright Brothers]] and department store owner Max Moorehouse.
*[[1912]] &ndash; The Deutsche Opernhaus (now [[Deutsche Oper Berlin]]) opens in the [[Berlin]] neighborhood of [[Charlottenburg]], with a production of [[Ludwig van Beethoven|Beethoven]]'s ''[[Fidelio]]''.
*[[1913]] &ndash; The first day of the [[Great Lakes Storm of 1913]], a massive blizzard that ultimately killed 250 and caused over $5 million (about $118,098,000 in 2013 dollars) damage. Winds reach hurricane force on this date.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The first issue of ''[[The New Republic]]'' magazine is published.
*  1914   &ndash; The [[German Empire|German]] colony of [[Jiaozhou Bay|Kiaochow Bay]] and its centre at [[Qingdao|Tsingtao]] are captured by Japanese forces.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Jeannette Rankin]] is the first woman elected to the [[United States]] [[Congress of the United States|Congress]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The Gregorian calendar date of the [[October Revolution]], which gets its name from the Julian calendar date of [[25 October]]. On this date in 1917, the Bolsheviks storm the [[Winter Palace]].
*  1917   &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Third Battle of Gaza]] ends: [[United Kingdom|British]] forces capture [[Gaza City|Gaza]] from the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[1918 influenza epidemic]] spreads to [[Western Samoa]], killing 7,542 (about 20% of the population) by the end of the year.
*  1918   &ndash; [[Kurt Eisner]] overthrows the [[Wittelsbach]] dynasty in the [[Kingdom of Bavaria]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; The first [[Palmer Raids|Palmer Raid]] is conducted on the second anniversary of the [[Russian Revolution (1917)|Russian Revolution]]. Over 10,000 suspected communists and anarchists are arrested in twenty-three different U.S. cities.
*[[1920]] &ndash; Patriarch [[Tikhon of Moscow|Tikhon]] issues a decree that leads to the formation of the [[Russian Orthodox Church Outside Russia]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; In [[New York City]], the [[Museum of Modern Art]] opens to the public.
*[[1931]] &ndash; The [[Chinese Soviet Republic]] is proclaimed on the anniversary of the [[Bolshevik Revolution|October Revolution]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Fiorello H. La Guardia]] is elected the 99th [[Mayor of New York City|mayor]] of [[New York City]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; In [[Tacoma, Washington]], the [[Tacoma Narrows Bridge (1940)|original Tacoma Narrows Bridge]] collapses in a [[storm|windstorm]], a mere four months after the bridge's completion.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Soviet [[hospital ship]] ''[[Armenia (ship)|Armenia]]'' is sunk by German planes while evacuating refugees and wounded military and staff of several [[Crimea]]n hospitals. It is estimated that over 5,000 people died in the sinking.
*[[1944]] &ndash; A [[Rail transport in Puerto Rico#Tragedy on election day in 1944|passenger train derails]] in [[Aguadilla]], [[Puerto Rico]] from excessive speed when descending a hill. 16 people are killed and 50 are injured.
*  1944   &ndash; Soviet spy [[Richard Sorge]], a half-Russian, half-German World War I veteran, is hanged by his Japanese captors along with 34 of his ring.
*  1944   &ndash; [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] elected for a record fourth term as President of the United States of America.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The first oil was taken in [[Neft Daşları|Oil Rocks (Neft Daşları)]], oldest offshore oil platform.
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Suez Crisis]]: The [[United Nations General Assembly]] adopts a resolution calling for the [[United Kingdom]], [[France]] and [[Israel]] to immediately withdraw their troops from [[Egypt]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: The [[Gaither Report]] calls for more [[United States|American]] missiles and [[fallout shelter]]s.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Wunder von Lengede]]: In [[Germany]], eleven miners are rescued from a collapsed [[Mining|mine]] after 14 days.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Carl Stokes|Carl B. Stokes]] is elected as Mayor of [[Cleveland, Ohio]], becoming the first [[African American]] mayor of a major American city.
*  1967   &ndash; [[US President]] [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] signs the [[Public Broadcasting Act of 1967]], establishing the [[Corporation for Public Broadcasting]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] overrides President [[Richard M. Nixon]]'s veto of the [[War Powers Resolution]], which limits presidential power to wage war without congressional approval.
*[[1975]] &ndash; In [[Bangladesh]], a joint force of [[people of Bangladesh|people]] and [[Military of Bangladesh|soldiers]] takes part in an [[Rebellion|uprising]] led by [[Col. Taher|Col. Abu Taher]] that ousts and kills [[Khaled Mosharraf|Brig. Khaled Mosharraf]], freeing the then [[House arrest|house-arrested]] [[Chief of Army Staff of the Bangladesh Army|army chief]] and future [[President of Bangladesh|president]] [[Major General|Maj-Gen.]] [[Ziaur Rahman]]. The day is occasionally observed as the [[National Revolution and Solidarity Day]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[1983 United States Senate bombing]]: a bomb explodes inside the [[United States Capitol]]. No one is injured, but an estimated $250,000 in damage is caused.
*[[1987]] &ndash; In [[Tunisia]], president [[Habib Bourguiba]] is overthrown and replaced by Prime Minister [[Zine El Abidine Ben Ali]].
*  1987   &ndash; Singapore's first [[Mass Rapid Transit (Singapore)|Mass Rapid Transit]] line was opened, starting with train services between [[Yio Chu Kang]] and [[Toa Payoh]] stations.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Douglas Wilder]] wins the governor's seat in [[Virginia]], becoming the first elected [[African American]] governor in the [[United States]].
*  1989   &ndash; [[David Dinkins]] becomes the first [[African American]] to be elected [[Mayor of New York City|mayor]] of [[New York City]].
*  1989   &ndash; [[East Germany|East German]] Prime Minister [[Willi Stoph]], along with his entire cabinet, is forced to resign after huge anti-government protests.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Mary Robinson]] becomes the first woman to be elected [[President of Ireland|President of the Republic of Ireland]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Magic Johnson]] announces that he is infected with [[HIV]] and retires from the [[National Basketball Association|NBA]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[WXYC]], the student radio station of the [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]], provides the world's first [[webcast|internet radio broadcast]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[NASA]] launches the [[Mars Global Surveyor]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Hillary Rodham Clinton]] is elected to the [[United States Senate]], becoming the first former [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] to win public office in the United States, although she was actually still the First Lady.
*  2000   &ndash; Controversial [[United States presidential election, 2000|US presidential election]] that is later resolved in the [[Bush v. Gore]] Supreme Court Case.
*  2000   &ndash; The U.S. [[Drug Enforcement Administration]] discovers one of the country's largest [[Lysergic acid diethylamide|LSD]] [[William Leonard Pickard|labs]] inside a converted military [[missile silo]] in [[Wamego, Kansas]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Sabena|SABENA]], the national airline of [[Belgium]], goes bankrupt.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Iran]] bans [[advertising]] of [[United States]] products.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Iraq War]]: The interim government of [[Iraq]] calls for a 60-day "[[state of emergency]]" as U.S. forces storm the insurgent stronghold of [[Fallujah]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Jokela school shooting]] in Tuusula, [[Finland]], resulting in the death of nine people.
*[[2012]] &ndash; An [[2012 Guatemala earthquake|earthquake]] off the Pacific coast of [[Guatemala]] kills at least 52 people.
